char *  outfilename

Copies one file to another using formatted I/O, one character at a time.

outfilename Name of output file
Returns:
0 if successful, 1 if error.

struct timeval * timeDifference ( struct timeval *  startTime,
struct timeval *  finishTime 
)

Calculates the difference between two timestamps and returns a new timestamp with the result. startTime must be less than finishTime

Parameters:
startTime The ealier time
finishTime The later time
Returns:
A pointer to a newly allocated timeval struct containing the difference between the two timestamps
Author:
Steven Kordell
